ygData.subject: Finding Firewood
ygData.msgSnippet: Teltoli gave a start as she heard Carnage bellow up to her, but she nodded and spread her wings, calling Yes Ma am! Right away Ma am! with a hint of laughter

Teltoli gave a start as she heard Carnage bellow up to her, but she 
nodded and spread her wings, calling "Yes Ma'am! Right away Ma'am!" 
with a hint of laughter in her voice before taking to the skies in 
search.

She knew there could have been dry wood in the clearing they had been 
in, but she was grateful to stretch her wings after a long.. and 
cramping night. 

Once she had cleared the trees, a smile spread across her face as she 
felt the warm sunlight coming up and beginning to shine. Focusing her 
eyes downwards for any place that there could be dry firewood. After 
about a minute a searching, her eyes sought out a tree that was a 
little smaller than the rest, and had maybe been sheltered by the 
other trees, so any moisture could have been prevented. She shrugged, 
and swooped down. She didn't know everything about this planet, nor 
did she pretend to.. but it made sense.

Landing on a fairly sturdy branch, she kept her wings out to steady 
herself and dug her claws into the branch. Transforming to her robot 
mode, she kept her grip with the agileness (is that even a word? LOL) 
of one who was light and not that tall. She looked around and found 
that there was indeed some very dry branches there, and she sighed. 
The Fuzor made a firm grip on the branch and wrenched down on the 
branch, snapping it off.

After getting several big peices, she held them tightly in her arms 
and stood up on the branch, wobbling slightly but managing to get her 
wings in the proper position. It was always harder to fly in bot 
mode. 

Teltoli flapped her wings and took off into the sky, looking for the 
clearing that Carnage was in. Her green eyes soon picked it out and 
she put her feet first, landing in the clearing fairly smoothly. She 
put the large peices of wood near the boar.

She stayed in her robot form just in case. "There you go. Sorry for 
the wait, but I needed a stretch of the wings anyway"


---------------
Steph F. Geeves

"Well," drawled Jack, "it looks like it'll be up to Teal'c and me to 
once again be 'babysitting' the two of you. Daniel has a building 
that's misbehaving and Carter's got spooky energy waves--gee, Teal'c, 
we'll be having more fun than sentient beings should be allowed to 
have."
	- "The Test" by TrishGirl
